Wisata Aceh akan Dipromosikan ke Negara-negara Eropa
01 Nov 2019, 15:42 by Nurcholis Maarif


Foto: dok Dinas Pariwisata Banda Aceh

Aceh - Dinas Pariwisata Banda Aceh menggandeng Gerakan Nasional Pecinta Pariwisata Indonesia (Genpari) untuk mempromosikan wisata yang ada di Aceh. Harapannya, Genpari dapat mempromosikan Banda Aceh ke beberapa negara Eropa dan memberikan gambaran yang positif."Kami memahami bahwa pandangan stereotipe disebabkan oleh dampak konflik masa lalu yang belum terhapus dari image masyarakat luar Aceh dan luar negeri tentang kondisi Aceh. Kami mintakan kepada Genpari dapat menjelaskan bahwa setelah penandatanganan MOU Helsinki, Aceh umumnya sangat kondusif," ujar Kepala Dinas Pariwisata Banda Aceh Iskandar dalam keterangan tertulis, Jumat (1/11/2019).Iskandar mengutip data Kemenkum HAM yang menunjukkan Banda Aceh sebagai daerah terkondusif di Indonesia. Selain itu, Banda Aceh memiliki potensi wisata dan seni budaya yang sangat eksotis dan layak untuk dikunjungi."Termasuk berbagai macam kuliner. Begitu juga konektivitas, amenitas, dan atraktif sangat mendukung untuk menerima kunjungan wisatawan," ujar Iskandar. Adapun Humas Genpari Sri Maryani menyampaikan, kegiatan yang dilakukan pihaknya ialah mempromosikan dan memperkenalkan budaya dan pariwisata Indonesia di luar negeri. Baik melalui pameran maupun pertunjukan seni budaya, kuliner, souvenir, destinasi, dan lain sebagainya. "Dalam waktu dekat, Genpari pusat akan melakukan lawatan ke beberapa negara. Mulai tanggal 20 November hingga 15 februari 2020, di antaranya Hungaria, Kroasia, Bosnia, dan beberapa negara lainnya di Eropa," ujarnya.Di akhir pertemuan, Sri menerima 500 set brosur wisata Banda Aceh dari Iskandar. Sri juga berjanji akan mempromosikan dan membagi brosur pariwisata Banda Aceh di setiap negara yang dikunjungi Genpari. (ega/ega)
text:
Aceh Tourism will be Promoted to European Countries
Nov 1, 2019, 15:42 by Nurcholis Maarif


Photo: dock of the Banda Aceh Tourism Office

Aceh - The Banda Aceh Tourism Office is collaborating with the National Movement for Indonesian Tourism Lovers (Genpari) to promote tourism in Aceh. The hope, Genpari can promote Banda Aceh to several European countries and provide a positive picture. "We understand that the stereotype view is caused by the impact of past conflicts that have not been erased from the image of people outside Aceh and abroad about the condition of Aceh. We ask Genpari to explain that after the signing of the Helsinki MOU, Aceh was generally very conducive, "said the Head of the Banda Aceh Tourism Office Iskandar in a written statement, Friday (11/01/2019). Iskandar cited data from the Ministry of Law and Human Rights which showed Banda Aceh as the most conducive region in Indonesia. In addition, Banda Aceh has the potential for tourism and cultural arts that are very exotic and worth visiting. "Including a variety of culinary delights. Likewise connectivity, amenities and attractiveness are very supportive for receiving tourist visits," said Iskandar. The Public Relations Genpari Sri Maryani said that the activity carried out by her party was to promote and introduce Indonesian culture and tourism abroad. Both through exhibitions and cultural arts performances, culinary, souvenirs, destinations, and so forth. "In the near future, the Genpari center will conduct a tour of several countries. From November 20 to 15 February 2020, including Hungary, Croatia, Bosnia, and several other countries in Europe," he said. At the end of the meeting, Sri received 500 sets of brochures Banda Aceh tour from Iskandar. Sri also promised to promote and distribute Banda Aceh tourism brochures in every country visited by Genpari. (ega / ega)
